meanings.definition: The standard unit of electrical resistance.
meanings.sent1: An ohm measures how difficult it is for electricity to flow.
meanings.sent2: The light bulb needed more ohms to prevent a power surge.
meanings.sent3: The toaster refused to work until it felt the right amount of ohms.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an ohm, resisting any distractions.
meanings.sent5: The concept of ohms can be as tricky as untangling a knot in a string of lights.

meanings.definition: A unit of electrical resistance equal to one volt per ampere.
meanings.sent1: The wire had a resistance of one ohm, limiting the current flow.
meanings.sent2: The circuit required a specific number of ohms to function properly.
meanings.sent3: The ohm in the circuit was like a traffic light controlling the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was an ohm, opposing any changes to the plan.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the concept of ohms is as crucial as knowing how to read a map.

meanings.sent1: The ohm led the yoga class with calm and grace.
meanings.sent2: She became an ohm after years of dedicated practice.
meanings.sent3: The ohm giggled when asked to touch her toes in yoga class.
meanings.sent4: He was a peaceful ohm in the chaotic world around him.
meanings.sent5: The ohm's presence in the yoga studio brought a sense of tranquility to everyone.
